title: Generalized Multiprotocol Label Switching (GMPLS) Ethernet Label Switching Architecture and Framework
abstract:
There has been significant recent work in increasing the
capabilities of Ethernet switches and Ethernet forwarding
models.  As a consequence, the role of Ethernet is rapidly expanding
into "transport networks" that previously were the domain of other
technologies such as
Synchronous Optical Network (SONET) / Synchronous Digital Hierarchy
(SDH), Time-Division Multiplexing (TDM), and Asynchronous Transfer Mode
(ATM).  This document defines an architecture and framework for a Generalized-
MPLS-based control plane for Ethernet in this "transport network" capacity.  
GMPLS has already been specified for similar technologies.  Some additional
extensions to the GMPLS control plane are needed, and this document
provides a framework for these extensions.  This document is not an Internet 
Standards Track specification; it is published for informational purposes.
